```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)
library(readxl)
library(usdata)
library(tm)
library(stringr)


library(kableExtra)
library(rpart)         # to train decision trees
library(rpart.plot)    # to plot decision trees
library(randomForest)  # random forests
library(gbm)           # boosting
```

```{r}
crimedata=read_csv("../data/clean/dataclean.csv")
```

```{r}
ggplot(crimedata, aes(x = theftrate)) +
  geom_histogram()+
  theme_bw()+
  scale_y_log10()
```
```{r}
crimedata %>% ggplot(aes(y=theftrate)) +
  geom_boxplot()+
  theme_bw()
```

```{r}
crimedata %>% select(state,county,theftrate) %>% arrange(desc(theftrate)) %>% head(10) %>%
  kable(format = "latex", row.names = NA, 
        booktabs = TRUE,
        digits = 3,
        col.names = c("State", "County","Theft Rate"),
        caption = "This a table showing the top 10 counties with the highest theft rate.") %>%
  kable_styling(position = "center") %>%
  kable_styling(latex_options = "HOLD_position")
```
